ingredients: Whole spices (4 green cardamoms, 2 black cardamoms, 1 bay leaf, 1-inch cinnamon stick, 4 cloves)

steps.title: Soak Rice
steps.description: Wash the basmati rice thoroughly under running water. Soak it in water for 30 minutes, then drain.

steps.title: Soak Saffron
steps.description: Warm the milk slightly and add saffron strands. Let it infuse and set aside.

steps.title: Fry Onions
steps.description: Heat oil in a pan. Add thinly sliced onions and fry until golden brown and crisp. Stir occasionally to prevent burning.

steps.title: Separate Fried Onions
steps.description: Once fried, drain onions on paper towel. Set aside half for garnishing and use the other half for marination.

steps.title: Prepare Nut Paste
steps.description: Grind cashew nuts and peeled almonds with a little water or milk to make a smooth, thick paste.

steps.title: Mix Marinade
steps.description: In a large bowl, combine curd, ginger-garlic paste, nut paste, fresh cream, garam masala, turmeric, red chili powder, white pepper, nutmeg, mace powder, salt, and half of the fried onions.

steps.title: Marinate Meat
steps.description: Add chicken or mutton pieces to the marinade. Mix well and let it rest for at least 1 hour, preferably in the refrigerator.

steps.title: Heat Ghee and Whole Spices
steps.description: In a heavy-bottomed pan or handi, heat ghee. Add whole spices: cardamoms, bay leaf, cinnamon stick, and cloves. Sauté for a few seconds until aromatic.

steps.title: Cook Marinated Meat
steps.description: Add the marinated meat to the pan. Cook on medium heat, stirring occasionally.

steps.title: Simmer Until Tender
steps.description: Cover and cook until the meat is tender and oil starts to separate from the masala. Add a little water if needed.

steps.title: Boil Water for Rice
steps.description: In a large pot, bring water to a boil. Add salt and optional whole spices (e.g., a bay leaf, cardamom).

steps.title: Parboil Rice
steps.description: Add soaked rice to the boiling water. Cook until 70% done (grains should still have a slight bite), then drain thoroughly.

steps.title: Start Biryani Layering
steps.description: In a thick-bottomed pan or handi, spread a layer of cooked meat with masala at the bottom.

steps.title: Add Rice Layer
steps.description: Spread a layer of parboiled rice evenly over the meat layer.

steps.title: Add Aromatics
steps.description: Drizzle the saffron-infused milk, rose water, and kewra water over the rice.

steps.title: Add Herbs and Onions
steps.description: Sprinkle chopped mint leaves, coriander leaves, and the remaining fried onions on top.

steps.title: Seal the Pot
steps.description: Cover the pan with a tight-fitting lid or seal with dough to trap the steam.

steps.title: Dum Cook the Biryani
steps.description: Cook on low heat for 20–25 minutes to allow flavors to meld using the traditional 'dum' method.

steps.title: Rest Before Serving
steps.description: Let the biryani rest for 5–10 minutes after turning off the heat before opening the lid.

steps.title: Serve Mughlai Biryani
steps.description: Gently mix the layers before serving to preserve texture. Serve hot with raita or salan.
